728844f-a.folder: Forest Avenue & Richmond Avenue, Staten Island, NY
728844f-a.text:
Forest Avenue, near Richmond Avenue, showing two old railroad cars that have been converted into a residence.
May 1927.
P.L. Sperr

728845f-a.folder: Forest Avenue & Richmond Avenue, Staten Island, NY
728845f-a.text:
Forest Avenue, adjoining the N.E. corner of Richmond Avenue.
May 21, 1932
F.L. Sperr

729329f-a.folder: Richmond Avenue & Forest Avenue, Staten Island, NY
729329f-a.text:
Richmond Avenue, east side, between Forest Avenue and Monsey Place. Mr. Sperr refers to this house as the D. C. Decker House. On Beers's 1874 map it appears as the J. Simonson house.
January 4, 1924
By Wm. T. Davis through P. L. Sperr

729330f-a.folder: Richmond Avenue & Forest Avenue, Staten Island, NY
729330f-a.text:
Richmond Avenue, east side, between Forest Avenue and Snoe Street, showing the barn on the David C. Decker property. Mr. P.L. Sperr states tkat the windows are from a church that
once stood in Hillside Cemetery.
January 4, 1924.
By Wm. T. Davis through P.L. Sperr
(2)
A view of the rear of the barn. It stands 150 feet back
of the avenue.
January 4, 1924.
P.L. Sperr

729330f-b.text:
Richmond Avenue, east side, between Forest Avenue and Snoe Street, showing the barn on the David C. Decker property. Mr. P.L. Sperr states tkat the windows are from a church that
once stood in Hillside Cemetery.
